Description: Fragment of a textile in red wool, plain weave, with deocration of two parallel stripes in undyed linen; applied and sewn to the plain weave is a band of blue wool with geometric decoration in undyed wool brocade; the reverse of the textile shows supplementary undyed linen, plain weave, applied and sewn at the upper part of the brocade to reinforce the edge; may be part of a mantle or could be a furnishing; plain weave: warp-red wool (S/13), weft-red wool (S/22), undyed linen (S/28); balanced plain weave on reverse: warp-undyed linen (S/16), weft-undyed linen (S/16); sewing: undyed linen (S spun Z ply); brocade: warp-blue and pink wool (Z/36), weft-blue wool (S or S paired/14), undyed wool (S/paired); one right angle edge preserved, other edges cut and ragged
Curator's comments: kept on board with small bags of fibres and a label in paper
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
